intro: Motandra poecilophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf motandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to elliptical, and its showy, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Motandra poecilophylla thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
